body:
**What happened**: kube-controller-manager starts but listens insecurely on IPv6, even if --secure-port and --bind-address is set **What you expected to happen**: kube-controller-manager just listens securely when settings are provided **How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: Start a cluster on v1.12.0 and set the systemd as follows: 
  --bind-address=127.0.0.1 \
  --kubeconfig=/REDACTED/controller-manager.kubeconfig \
  --cluster-cidr=your-pod-cidr \
  --cluster-name=clustername \
  --cluster-signing-cert-file=/REDACTED/ca.crt \
  --cluster-signing-key-file=/REDACTED/ca.key \
  --controllers=*,bootstrapsigner,tokencleaner \
  --leader-elect=true \
  --profiling=false \
  --root-ca-file=/REDACTED/ca.crt \
  --service-account-private-key-file=/REDACTED/sa.key \
  --service-cluster-ip-range=your-svc-cidr \
  --use-service-account-credentials=true \
  --secure-port=10259 \
  --v=2
**Anything else we need to know?**: - --kubeconfig is deprecated but the binary does not start without it - --authorization-kubeconfig is documented where? (I cannot find it in the docs, maybe my fault) - the cluster bootstraps correctly and network (weave) + dns (coredns) is working - scheduling of pods work - csr of nodes get approved and issued **Environment**: - Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): 1.12.0 - Cloud provider or hardware configuration: bare-metal - OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.04.01 LTS - Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.15.0-34-generic - Install tools: self-made (Kelseys Hard-Way guide) - Others: /area controller-manager /sig cluster-lifecycle
